channel.title: Begginer
channel.description:
Hi, I have recently just started to learn java. I am not a copmplete noob when it comes to programming used to write tutorials on basic programming in scar but pascal is probably a lot less complex than java. Anyway Im just posting to ask if anyone out their who would be able to give me some advice on java programming over msn or something, im not going to be asking a million questions, well maybe a few at the start but after that the only time ill bug you is when my code will not compile or i do not understand something. my email address is
grimand_evil@hotmail.com
if you dont want to add me on msn dont be afraid to throw any useful links at the bottom of this page
cheers :D

item.title: Begginer
item.dc:creator: @Benz Benz
item.description:
@Benz wrote:

[quote=“Davidude, post:10, topic:257034”]Head first for Java seems like a good book.

[We are still on that subject right?][/quote]

Head First Java*

And yes, it is a good book.

Read full topic

item.title: Begginer
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:7, topic:257034”]You didn’t specify what book, leaving it open for argument. “Java for Dummies” is the book he would have gone away and bought, no doubt.[/quote]Yeah probably because some other idiot told him to.

I think those books are terrible, amongst the 21 days books.

Read full topic

item.title: Begginer
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Ollie, you’re an idiot.

Java for Dummbies is shit.

Anything written by Herbert Schildt is good, but that’s if you’ve either exhausted the java docs or don’t find them interesting.

Read full topic

item.title: Begginer
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Pwnd says buy java for dummies, then later realise its shit.

I say read http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/ for free.

Read full topic

item.description:

Buying a book is the best bet.
